body_html: regression=True needed to be specified in the ForestHParams because TensorForestEstimator by default assumes a classification problem. There is an implicit num_outputs variable created upon initialization of the estimator and it is set to False if regression was not specified. If regression is specified, then num_outputs = num_classes and checkpoints are saved normally.
body_text: regression=True needed to be specified in the ForestHParams because TensorForestEstimator by default assumes a classification problem. There is an implicit num_outputs variable created upon initialization of the estimator and it is set to False if regression was not specified. If regression is specified, then num_outputs = num_classes and checkpoints are saved normally.
body: `regression=True` needed to be specified in the `ForestHParams` because `TensorForestEstimator` by default assumes a classification problem. There is an implicit `num_outputs` variable created upon initialization of the estimator and it is set to `False` if `regression` was not specified. If `regression` is specified, then `num_outputs = num_classes` and checkpoints are saved normally.
